      • addTitleScreen

        public static void addTitleScreen()
        Description: Creates the main menu where the user can select to either begin the game or to get instructions. If they begin the game, a JTextField will appear to ask for a user name Pre Conditions: - must be called Post condition - instructions will be shown or their user name will be saved and the user can select their team

      • helpScreen

      • selectionSort

        public static void selectionSort(java.lang.String[] array,
                                 int start)
        Description: Sorts an array of Strings in alphabetical order (a-z) using selection sort and recursion. This is used in the program to sort a list of Pokemon names so binary search can be used later Pre condition: array must not be null, start must be greater than or equal to 0 and less array.length Post condition: the array in sorted in alphabetical order (a-z)
        Parameters:
        array, - the array of Strings to be sorted
        start - the beginning of the unsorted part of the array, used in recursion

      • binarySearch

        public static int binarySearch(java.lang.String[] array,
                               java.lang.String p,
                               int start,
                               int end)
        Description: Determines the location of a given String in an array of Strings using binary search and recursion. If the given String is not in the array, -1 is returned instead Pre condition: array and p must not be null, start and end must be greater than 0 and end must be greater then or equal to start Post condition: The index of p in the array is returned or -1 if p is not in the array
        Parameters:
        array - An array of Strings
        p - the String that we are looking for
        start, - the beginning of the possible block of the array that p could be in, used in recursion
        end, - the end of the the possible block of the array that p could be in, used in recursion
        Returns:
        the index of p in the array if p is in the array and -1 if p isn't in the array

      • pokemonSelect

        public static void pokemonSelect(boolean custom,
                                 boolean random,
                                 boolean legendary,
                                 boolean starters,
                                 boolean cute,
                                 boolean mews)
        ; Description: If the user selected a preset team, their team will be automatically decidedIf the user opts for a custom team, they will be prompted in the console to enter their own Pokemon, and continue to do so until 6 valid Pokemon have been entered. These pokemon, whether preset or entered will be saved to a Pokemon array that contains all 6 of them. The computer will then get 6 randomly generated Pokemon to battle with Pre- Condition: - A team has to be selected in the
        Parameters:
        custom - - true if user selected custom team, prompts them in console to enter their own Pokemon until 6 valid ones have been chosen and added into their Pokemon array
        random- - True when they want random team. Will randomly choose 6 pokemon for their team
        legendary - - true when they want the legendary load out Will fill their team with 6 selected legendary Pokemon
        starters- - true when the want starter pokemon. Will fill their team with 6 max evolutions of famous starter Pokemon
        cute - - true when they select the cute preset. Will fill their team with 6 cute pokemon
        mews - - true when they choose the mew preset. WIll fill their team with 6 mews because who doesn't love mew

      • preset

        public static void preset()
        Description: allows the user to select their team. JFrame will open that contains 6 buttons, 5 of which will create a pre-set team if the user selects. If the user opts for a custom team, they will be able to make their own team. Based on what button was pressed, the pokemonSelect method will be called, with different boolean variables passed. The teams are selected here based on said variables Pre Conditions - must be called - all images must be valid and have proper file path Post condition - A team will be selected and saved in the pokemonSelect method

      • options

        public static void options()
        Description: Opens a JFrame below the battle screen. This contains four options, the attack button which calls the attackFrames method which will open up the Pokemon's attacks, the swap button which will call the swap method, which will option the players swap menu and allow them to change Pokemon, the Pokemon info which links them to the official pokedex which contains info about their current Pokemon, and help, which opens the instructions menu Pre Conditions - player must have array full with 6 non-null Pokemon for the swap screen to function - Pokemon must contain valid attacks for the attack screen to function - info menu graphic must be found for the help button to work Post Condition: - The JFrame that they chose will open if valid. - It not always valid, for example, cannot attack if current Pokemon has fainted

      • speedCheck

        public static void speedCheck()

      • pokemonSwap

        public static void pokemonSwap()
        Description: USed to create a JFrame beside the battle screen when the user opts to swap Pokemon or their current one faints. Adds all six of their Pokemn that were created earlier into this frame as buttons that contain the image icon of said Pokemon. The background becomes red once a Pokemon faints by checking their fainted instance variable. Pokemon that they want to swap in must be alive for the button to work. If they are, and their button is pressed, the players current pokemon will now become the one that they opted to put in. The health bar will be reset to the correct size based on that pokemons health, and that Pokemons cry will be played. It will then begin the swap animation by setting swap equal to true, which triggers the timer in the paint component to begin the swapping animation Pre- Conditions: - swap button in options must be pressed or the current Pokemon must be fainted - The player must have a full team of 6 Pokemon, all which are not null - at least one Pokemon must not have fainted for any buttons to work - file must be found for their image to be added to the button - name must be correct in order to find the right files Post Conditions: - the current pokemon will swap - swap equals true - swap animation will begin - health bar resets to correct size - set the swap frame invisible - proper cry is played of the swapped pokemon

      • swapSize

        public static void swapSize()

      • swap

        public static void swap(int i)

      • computerAttack

        public static void computerAttack()
        Description: Selects random move from the current computers move pool to use against the users Pokemon. This is done by generating a random number between 0 and 3, and using said number to get the move from that index. This move will do the appropriate damage to the user based on its damage calculation, and sounds will be played based on the effectiveness of the move by sending the correct file name to the playSound method. The file name is found by getting the message of the move after it is used. There will also be an appropriate message saved that will be displayed Pre-Conditions: - must be called - has to be computers turn - current computer Pokemon must not be null - current computer POkemon must have 4 functioning moves Post Condition: - current player Pokemon health and health bar will decsreas accoringly - sound effects will be players - attack animations will begin - damaged = true meaning that the computer has hit the user

      • attackFrames

        public static void attackFrames()
        Description: Creates JFrame beside battle frame that contains all possible attacks that the player's current Pokemon knows. these attacks are saved as buttons that are the color of the moves type and also contain the moves types icon, both of which are received from different hash maps that get either the icon or color when given the String of the type as the key. These buttons can only be pressed when applicable (used a boolean variable wait that only becomes true once it is the users turn to attack). When an attack is selected, the computers health decreasing according to the moves damage calculation, the appropriate sound is played based on the effectivity of the move, and appropriate messages are saved that contain the Pokemon name and what move it did, and the effectiveness of the move Pre-Condition: - has to be called; - for any button to work, wait must equal true, meaning that it is the users turn to attack - the hash maps must return the appropriate color/icon - hash maps must find the correct image icon (files must be correct) - current player Pokemon must not be null - current player Pokemon must know moves that are saved in the moves database - attack button must be selected in the option frame Post-condition: - computer's health bar is decreased based on the damage of the attack - sound effects play - computerDamaged = true (meaning that the computer has been attacked) - the attack animation will play - attack frame set to invisible

      • faintCheck

        public static void faintCheck()
        Description: checks to see if the current player's Pokemon has fainted by comparing it's health bar. If it has fainted, then it sets its fainted instance variable to true and plays appropriate faint sound file by calling the playSounds method and sending the appropriate path to said file. as well as setting the text variable to a message that displays that the player's Pokemon has fainted Pre-Condition: - has to be called - Current player Pokemon cannot be null - player Pokemon has to have appropriate name for text to display proper message - proper sound files must be in proper location in the file system Post-Condition: - The fainted instance variable will be set to true if it was determined that the Pokemon has fainted - Fainted instance variable will remain true if the Pokemon has not fainted - sound file for fainting noise will play if they faint, or the cry noise for the Pokemon that they swap in will play if they do swap one in - text will be saved to an appropriate message - player forced to swap Pokemon - if all six of the players Pokemon have fainted, the lose method will be called

      • computerFaintCheck

        public static void computerFaintCheck()
        Description: checks to see if the current computer's Pokemon has fainted by comparing it's health bar. If it has fainted, then it sets its fainted instance variable to true and plays appropriate faint sound file by calling the playSounds method and sending the appropriate path to said file. as well as setting the text variable to a message that displays that the computer's Pokemon has fainted Pre-Condition: - has to be called - Current computer Pokemon cannot be null - computer Pokemon has to have appropriate name for text to display proper message - proper sound files must be in proper location in the file system Post-Condition: - The fainted instance variable will be set to true if it was determined that the Pokemon has fainted - Fainted instance variable will remain true if the Pokemon has not fainted - sound file for fainting noise will play if they faint, or the cry noise for the Pokemon that they swap in will play if they do swap one in - text will be saved to an appropriate message - computers current Pokemon swaps to the next one in the party - if all Pokemon have fainted, the win method will be called

      • iconMap

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,javax.swing.ImageIcon> iconMap()

      • colourMap

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.awt.Color> colourMap()

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Description: Paints the battle graphics onto the battle JFrame. These graphics include the player's Pokemon, the computer's Pokemon, both Pokemon's health bars names and levels, both 'trainers'/username, as well as desired messages. These are animated using a timer that constantly changes variables used to size/set dimensions of graphics, and then repaints them Pre- Condition: - The battle screen hs to be painted or repainted - for any timers to be activated (and start animations), one Pokemon must be swapped in or damaged - Both the player's and computer's current Pokemon must not be null Post-Condition: - The battle screen will be repainted with the desired graphics/ animations
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - - graphical 'stuff' inherited from the JPanel thingy

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Description: Is invoked when one of two timers go off (computer or timer). Depending on the circumstances, which include which timer is used to call, and whether or not a Pokemon has been damaged or swapped in, it will begin an animation sequence. If the Pokemon has been damaged, it will flash by setting a visibility boolean variable to true and false in alternating sequences, and the attacked Pokemon's health bar will gradually decrease by constantly decreasing the length in which the filled green health occupies. If a Pokemon is swapped in, it will 'zoom' in by constantly increasing a size variable that causes the Pokemon to grow in size until the desired dimensions are met. The placement of the Pokemon also changes based on another variable that constantly decreases, causing the POkemon to gradually fall out of sight Pre-Condition: - Of of two timers have to be activated - for these timers to go off, one of the Pokemon must be either swapped in or damaged - Current computer and player Pokemon cannot be null Post-Condition: -the battle screen will be constantly repainted with the new image dimensions - because these dimensions change, it makes the Pokemon and health bars animated - checks to see if the current Pokemon have fainted
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e: - It is the action (from one of the timers) that triggers this event
